emuInput.TitMainTitle: Duke Ellington talking with Pittsburgh Courier columnist Julia Bumry Jones in Loendi Club
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 10, 1945, pg. 8, reads: "Highlights in a Brilliant Career of journalism that outlined the name of Julia Bumry Jones in incandescents that could be seen throughout the reading nation, were these moments chosen above from among the many such in her twenty-five years as women's editor of The Courier. Jule, affectionately known as Talk O' Town, after her weekly column that made history... With the Duke of Ellington, another of her friends, Jule is shown during one of his frequent visits to Pittsburgh when her hospitality was unquestioned and her parties 'the' thing... - Courier Photos by Harris."
